job_title: Senior Manager, Music Label Deal Analysis - FP&A
job_description: Senior Manager, Music Label Deal Analysis - FP&ANew York, NYFinance – Financial Planning and Analysis /Permanent /On-siteApply for this jobSpotify is looking for an exceptional Senior Manager to lead its Music Label Deal Analysis team within FP&A. Your primary focus will be on leading and driving forward the quantitative rigor behind the licensing deals we negotiate with our global music label partners. You will partner closely with Licensing, Legal, Finance, and cross-functional business partners to evaluate commercial terms, build robust financial models, and guide data-driven decision making for negotiations that shape Spotify’s long-term economics with the recorded music industry.This is a high-visibility, high-impact role at the intersection of music, strategy, and finance. The ideal candidate blends advanced analytical acumen with strong business judgment and exceptional communication skills. You will start with 2 direct reports and be based out of NYC, reporting to the Head of Strategic Planning & Licensing Finance.What You'll DoPartner closely with the Licensing and Legal teams to analyze, structure, and support negotiations for label deals across major, indie, and regional partners.Own the quantitative workstream for deal evaluation, including financial modeling, sensitivity analysis, and scenario planning.Translate complex deal structures into clear economic implications for senior leadership, providing data-driven recommendations that balance strategic and financial considerations.Develop frameworks for assessing deal performance, critical metrics, and long-term cost implications within Spotify’s music business model.Work cross-functionally with Finance, Engineering, Music Product, and Data teams to ensure alignment on assumptions, methodology, and business impact.Support ongoing deal operations by modeling amendments, extensions, and new rights categories as music industry dynamics evolve.Contribute to internal processes and tooling improvements, helping streamline how Spotify evaluates and manages music licensing economics.Stay current on industry trends, regulatory developments, and competitive dynamics that influence commercial deal structures.Who You Are7+ years of professional working experience, preferably in or Music Deal Analysis at a technology company, Investment Banking, or Commercial Finance/FP&A at a technology companyDeep experience building complex financial models and performing scenario analysis with limited direction. Competence with SQL and experience performing analysis on large datasetsDemonstrated ability to partner with legal, business affairs, or deal-making teams and translate commercial terms into financial outcomes.Strong work ethic with the ability to fluidly transition from leading and managing work to being able to individually contribute (“hands on keyboard” skills) as situations and timelines require.Sharp attention to detail but an eye towards using the 80/20 rule to address problems, including the ability to communicate and empathize across a wide range of audiences, spanning on-the-ground to executive partners.Very strong project management, planning and interpersonal skills, including the ability to lead on multiple projects simultaneously and deliver work under tight timelines.Deep intellectual curiosity with a desire to constantly understand. One extra question will lead to one extra learning, but hundreds of new ideas when combined with every learning before it.Where You'll BeThis role is based in our New York, NY offices.We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home. We ask that you come into the office 3 times per week.The United States base range for this position is $152,981 - $218,544 plus equity. The benefits available for this position include health insurance, six month paid parental leave, 401(k) retirement plan, monthly meal allowance, 23 paid days off, 13 paid flexible holidays, paid sick leave. These ranges may be modified in the future.Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.Apply for this job
title: Senior Manager, Music Label Deal Analysis - FP&A
description:
Spotify is looking for an exceptional Senior Manager to lead its Music Label Deal Analysis team within FP&A. Your primary focus will be on leading and driving forward the quantitative rigor behind the licensing deals we negotiate with our global music label partners. You will partner closely with Licensing, Legal, Finance, and cross-functional business partners to evaluate commercial terms, build robust financial models, and guide data-driven decision making for negotiations that shape Spotify’s long-term economics with the recorded music industry.

This is a high-visibility, high-impact role at the intersection of music, strategy, and finance. The ideal candidate blends advanced analytical acumen with strong business judgment and exceptional communication skills. You will start with 2 direct reports and be based out of NYC, reporting to the Head of Strategic Planning & Licensing Finance.
